item.description:
Sat 11/7/09, 12:30pm (I will meet you in the lobby at 12:00pm)

the Opera - Turandot, by Puccini


Fathom presents the excitement of The Met: Live in HD on the Big Screen! The broadcast of Puccini's opera Turandot will be presented live for only one day on Saturday, November 7, 2009 at 1 PM ET in select theatres nationwide. Director Franco Zeffirelli's breathtaking production of Puccini's last opera is a favorite of the Met repertoire.

Synopsis: Director Franco Zeffirelli’s breathtaking production of Puccini’s last opera is a favorite of the Met repertoire. Maria Guleghina plays the ruthless Chinese princess of the title, whose hatred of men is so strong that she has all suitors who can’t solve her riddles beheaded. Marcello Giordani sings Calàf, the unknown prince who eventually wins her love and whose solos include the famous “Nessun dorma.”

I know this isn't the most convenient location for many of you, but this is the only theater that I could find that still had tickets available.

On that note, if you are interested, please purchase your ticket ASAP since these shows sell out quickly
http://www.fandango.c...
Online ticket price $22

Please post a comment when you RSVP saying if you have bought your ticket or not. I will only count as a "yes," whoever posted that they have bought a ticket.

item.name: Opera at the Met, (at cinemas): Turandot, Italian w/ English subtitles
